answers.answer: Hi,This may be something to be concerned about.  It could be something simple, and probably not at all related to the thyroid.  But best to see your doctor.You would also need to be tested for diabetes, and I hope they tested your thyroid levels.  If they did, please post the results.
I am a type 2 diabetic and on an insulin pump.The results of my last thyroid test were a tsh of 1.34they did not test the t3 or t4's.Penny
Just wanted to make sure you saw this I replied with my TSH yesterday
Hi Penny,the TSH looks ok, but really need to test FT3 and FT4 to see every thing is ok.I think you should see your doctor and let him have a look at the sores.

question: I was diagnosed on my biopsy with numerous groups of follicular epithelium and occassional groups of Hurthle cells and told to come back in 6 months and because of my insurance I cannot just go any where for a second opinion. The last week and a half I have noticed open sores under my armpits and on side of breast is this something I need to be concerned about? I have not changed anything no new medicines and no new soaps everything is the same that I been using. Should I contact my doctor? I am extremely tired all the time and never feel like eating.
title: Open sores do I need to be concerned?
